Package cellularAutomata.lattice

Interface Summary
Lattice A lattice is a grid or topology of connected Cells designed with a data structure such as a linked list, array, tree, etc.
 

Class Summary
BahrLattice A two-dimensional square lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and a nearest-neighbor neighborhood that varies with time.
FourNeighborSquareLattice A simple two-dimensional square lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and four nearest neighbors (von Neumann neighborhood).
GlobalSquareLattice A simple two-dimensional square lattice with every cell being a neighbor to every other cell.
HexagonalLattice A hexagonal lattice with wrap around boundary conditions.
MargolusLattice A two-dimensional square lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and a nearest-neighbor neighborhood that varies with time and position.
MargolusOneDimensionalLattice A one-dimensional version of the Margolus lattice.
MooreRadiusOneDimLattice A one-dimensional square lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and a Moore neighborhood of radius r.
MooreRadiusTwoDimLattice A two-dimensional square lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and a Moore neighborhood of radius r.
NextNearestOneDimLattice A standard one-dimensional lattice with nearest and next-nearest neighbors, and wrap around boundary conditions.
NextNearestSquareLattice A simple two-dimensional square lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and eight nearest and 16 next-nearest neighbors.
OneDimensionalLattice A one-dimensional lattice.
RandomAsymmetricSquareLattice A simple two-dimensional square lattice with random neighbors for each cell.
RandomGaussianLattice A simple two-dimensional square lattice where each cell has random neighbors distributed normally about the cell with a standard deviation of 1.
RandomSmallWorldLattice A simple two-dimensional square lattice where each cell has random neighbors distributed with power-law connectivity.
SquareLattice A simple two-dimensional square lattice with eight nearest neighbors (Moore neighborhood).
StandardOneDimensionalLattice A standard one-dimensional lattice with nearest neighbors and wrap around boundary conditions.
TriangularLattice A simple two-dimensional triangular lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and 3 nearest neighbors.
TwelveNeighborTriangularLattice A simple two-dimensional triangular lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and 12 nearest neighbors.
TwoDimensionalLattice A two-dimensional lattice.
VonNeumannRadiusLattice A two-dimensional diamond-shaped square lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and a von Neumann neighborhood of radius r.
